seoData.title: ChatGPT Prompts for Email Marketing - 15+ Expert Templates | PromptWritingStudio
seoData.description: Discover 15+ effective ChatGPT prompts for email marketing campaigns. Our expert-crafted templates help you create better emails, improve open rates, and boost conversions.

promptTemplates.title: Email Subject Line Generator
promptTemplates.description: Create high-converting email subject lines for any campaign.
promptTemplates.prompt: Generate 10 compelling email subject lines for a [type of email campaign] promoting [product/service/content] to [target audience]. The key benefit we want to highlight is [main benefit/selling point]. Our brand voice is [describe brand voice: casual, professional, playful, etc.]. Include a mix of approaches: curiosity-driven, benefit-focused, urgency-based, question-based, and personalized. For each subject line, explain why it would be effective. Keep subject lines under 50 characters for mobile optimization.
promptTemplates.example:
1. "Last Day: 30% Off Your First Design Package" - Uses urgency and clear value proposition
2. "The Design Secret Most Startups Miss" - Creates curiosity while implying valuable insider knowledge
3. "[Name], Transform Your Brand in Just 7 Days" - Personalized with specific timeframe and transformation promise...
tips: A/B test different subject line approaches to see what resonates with your audience
Avoid spam trigger words like 'free', 'guarantee', and excessive punctuation
Consider your audience's pain points and desires when crafting subject lines

promptTemplates.title: Welcome Email Sequence
promptTemplates.description: Create a 5-part welcome email sequence for new subscribers or customers.
promptTemplates.prompt: Create a 5-email welcome sequence for new [subscribers/customers] of our [type of business]. Our product/service is [brief description] and our target audience is [target audience description]. Our brand voice is [describe brand voice]. For each email, provide: 1) Subject line, 2) Main goal of the email, 3) Opening hook, 4) Key content sections with headers, 5) Call-to-action, and 6) Recommended send timing. Email 1 should welcome and deliver any promised lead magnet. Email 2 should introduce our brand story. Email 3 should highlight key benefits/features. Email 4 should address common objections. Email 5 should present an offer or next steps.
promptTemplates.example:
EMAIL 1: WELCOME & LEAD MAGNET DELIVERY
Subject: Welcome to [Brand] - Your [Lead Magnet] Inside!
Goal: Deliver lead magnet and set expectations for the sequence
Timing: Immediately after signup

Opening Hook: Welcome to the [Brand] community! We're thrilled you've joined our [number] of [subscribers/customers] who are [achieving desired outcome]...
tips: Personalize each email with the subscriber's name and relevant details
Keep emails focused on a single goal to avoid overwhelming readers
Space out the sequence appropriately (typically 2-3 days between emails)

promptTemplates.title: Abandoned Cart Email
promptTemplates.description: Create effective abandoned cart recovery emails.
promptTemplates.prompt: Write an abandoned cart recovery email for our [type of business] selling [products/services]. The customer added [specific product(s)] to their cart but didn't complete checkout. Our brand voice is [describe brand voice]. Include: 1) An attention-grabbing subject line, 2) A friendly reminder about their cart items, 3) A section addressing common objections or hesitations, 4) Social proof (suggest the type of testimonial or review to include), 5) A clear call-to-action to return to checkout, 6) A secondary section with 2-3 recommended related products, and 7) Any urgency element (like limited stock or time-limited discount). The email should be conversational and helpful, not pushy.
promptTemplates.example:
ABANDONED CART RECOVERY EMAIL
Subject: Your [Product Name] is Waiting For You!

Hi [Customer Name],

I noticed you were checking out our [Product Name] earlier but didn't complete your purchase. Your cart is saved and ready whenever you are!

[Product Image with Brief Description]

Many customers initially hesitate because they wonder about [common objection]. Here's what [Customer Name], a recent buyer, had to say: "[Brief testimonial addressing the common objection]"...
tips: Include a clear image of the abandoned product
Consider offering a small, time-limited discount to encourage completion
Make the checkout process as simple as possible - include a direct link

promptTemplates.title: Email Newsletter Template
promptTemplates.description: Create engaging newsletter templates for regular audience communication.
promptTemplates.prompt: Design a template for a [weekly/monthly] email newsletter for our [type of business]. Our audience consists of [target audience description] interested in [topics of interest]. Our brand voice is [describe brand voice]. Create a structured template with: 1) 3 subject line formulas we can adapt for each issue, 2) An engaging introduction section format, 3) 3-5 content section templates with headers and description of what goes in each (e.g., featured article, news roundup, tip of the week), 4) A promotional section template for our products/services, 5) Call-to-action examples, 6) Sign-off format. For each section, provide specific examples we could use in our first newsletter.
promptTemplates.example:
EMAIL NEWSLETTER TEMPLATE
SUBJECT LINE FORMULAS:
1. [Number] [Topic] Tips for [Desired Outcome] This [Timeframe]
2. The [Timeframe] [Industry] Update: [Key Topic] + [Benefit]
3. [Question about pain point]? Try These [Number] [Solutions]

INTRODUCTION SECTION:
Greeting that references current events or season
Brief personal update from the brand
Teaser of what's in this issue with clear value proposition...
tips: Maintain a consistent structure so readers know what to expect
Keep the design mobile-friendly with a single-column layout
Balance valuable content with promotional material (80/20 rule)

promptTemplates.title: Re-engagement Email Campaign
promptTemplates.description: Create emails to win back inactive subscribers or customers.
promptTemplates.prompt: Create a 3-part re-engagement email campaign for subscribers who haven't opened or clicked our emails in [time period, e.g., 3 months]. We are a [type of business] serving [target audience]. For each email, provide: 1) Subject line, 2) Preview text, 3) Main message and copy, 4) Specific offer or incentive (if applicable), 5) Call-to-action, and 6) Recommended timing. Email 1 should be a gentle check-in. Email 2 should highlight what they're missing and offer value. Email 3 should be a final attempt with a strong incentive before we clean our list. Include a brief note on how to segment recipients based on their response to optimize future campaigns.
promptTemplates.example:
RE-ENGAGEMENT EMAIL 1: GENTLE CHECK-IN
Subject: We miss you, [Name]!
Preview Text: Are we still a good fit for your inbox?

Hi [Name],

It's been a while since you've opened our emails, and we wanted to check in. We're constantly working to provide valuable content on [topic/industry], and we want to make sure we're still delivering what you're interested in...
tips: Personalize these emails as much as possible with subscriber name and history
Test different incentives to see what drives the highest re-engagement
Be prepared to remove non-responsive subscribers after the campaign

promptTemplates.title: Promotional Email Campaign
promptTemplates.description: Create compelling promotional emails for product launches or special offers.
promptTemplates.prompt: Design a promotional email campaign for our [product/service] [launch/sale/special offer]. Our target audience is [target audience description] and our unique selling proposition is [main benefit or feature]. Our brand voice is [describe brand voice]. Create an email that includes: 1) An attention-grabbing subject line with preview text, 2) A compelling opening that creates excitement or urgency, 3) A clear presentation of the offer with key benefits highlighted, 4) Pricing details with any special discounts clearly explained, 5) Social proof elements (suggest testimonial types or statistics to include), 6) FAQ section addressing common objections, 7) A primary call-to-action and a secondary option, and 8) Any urgency elements like deadlines or limited availability. The email should be persuasive without being pushy.
promptTemplates.example:
PROMOTIONAL EMAIL
Subject: Introducing [Product]: The [Benefit] Solution You've Been Waiting For
Preview Text: Special launch pricing ends Friday!

Hi [Name],

Today's the day! After months of development and testing, we're thrilled to announce the official launch of [Product Name].

[PRODUCT IMAGE WITH CAPTION]

WHAT IS [PRODUCT NAME]?
[Product Name] is the first [product category] that [unique benefit]. Unlike other solutions that [common problem with alternatives], our [product/service] [key differentiator]...
tips: Focus on benefits rather than features throughout the email
Use visuals strategically to showcase the product/service
Create a sense of urgency without using manipulative tactics

promptTemplates.title: Customer Feedback Request Email
promptTemplates.description: Create emails that effectively solicit customer feedback and reviews.
promptTemplates.prompt: Write a customer feedback request email for our [product/service] that encourages recipients to share their experience. Our business is [brief description] serving [target audience]. Our brand voice is [describe brand voice]. The email should include: 1) A subject line that encourages opening, 2) A personalized greeting, 3) A brief explanation of why their feedback matters to us, 4) Clear instructions on how to provide feedback (survey, review site, reply email, etc.) with direct links, 5) An estimate of how long the feedback process will take, 6) Any incentive we're offering for their time (if applicable), 7) Reassurance that both positive and constructive feedback is valuable, and 8) A sincere thank you. The tone should be appreciative and not pushy.
promptTemplates.example:
FEEDBACK REQUEST EMAIL
Subject: [Name], how was your experience with [Product/Service]?
Preview Text: We'd love your honest thoughts (takes just 2 minutes)

Hi [Customer Name],

Thank you for [specific action - purchasing/using/subscribing to] [Product/Service Name]. Now that you've had some time to experience it, I'd love to hear your thoughts.

Your feedback directly helps us improve and better serve customers like you. Would you be willing to take our quick 2-minute survey?

[PROMINENT BUTTON: Share Your Feedback]...
tips: Send the request at the right time (after customer has had sufficient experience)
Keep any surveys or feedback forms as short and simple as possible
Follow up on negative feedback personally to show you're listening

faqs.question: How can I improve my email open rates using these prompts?
faqs.answer: To improve open rates, focus on the Email Subject Line Generator prompt to create compelling, curiosity-driving subject lines. Test different approaches (questions, numbers, personalization) with A/B testing. Also, use the Re-engagement Email Campaign prompt to win back inactive subscribers. Remember that sender name, send time, and list quality also significantly impact open rates, so combine great subject lines with proper email sending practices.

faqs.question: How long should my marketing emails be?
faqs.answer: The ideal email length depends on your purpose and audience. For promotional emails, keep them concise (150-200 words) with clear CTAs. For newsletters and educational content, 300-500 words often works well. Welcome emails and abandoned cart emails should be brief and focused. Our email prompts are designed to create appropriately sized emails for each purpose, but you can always request shorter or longer versions based on your specific needs.

faqs.question: How do I make my emails more personalized beyond using the subscriber's name?
faqs.answer: True personalization goes beyond using a subscriber's name. Use our prompts to create segmented content based on subscriber behavior (pages visited, products viewed), purchase history, or quiz/survey responses. Modify the prompts to include conditional sections based on subscriber attributes. For example, in the Welcome Email Sequence prompt, you can specify different content for segments like 'new to the industry' versus 'experienced professionals' to create truly personalized journeys.

faqs.question: How frequently should I send marketing emails?
faqs.answer: Email frequency depends on your industry, content value, and audience preferences. Most businesses find success with 1-4 emails per month for newsletters and regular communications. For specific campaigns like welcome sequences, follow the timing recommendations in our Welcome Email Sequence prompt (typically more frequent initially, then tapering off). The best approach is to set expectations during signup and then test different frequencies with your specific audience to find the optimal balance.
